Livermore wineries struggle to be taken seriously. Will new initiatives turn the tide?

After decades of trying to gain national recognition, the wineries of Livermore Valley remain frustrated that they still can’t get the respect of Napa and Sonoma. New initiatives are under way that could raise Livermore wine’s profile, but some vintners say they don’t have time to wait and are relocating elsewhere.

‘Everybody is really scared’: Ukraine’s Markovetskyy plays for USF amid horror at home

Every morning and every night, as he struggles to concentrate on the daily routine of a college student-athlete, University of San Francisco center Volodymyr Markovetskyy talks to his parents by phone. They paint a harrowing picture of life in his native Ukraine.
